TITLE: Note Taking
DEF: Summarizing and recording significant information for future reference.
TASK: The Note Taking pattern is a strategic approach to recording vital information from lectures, readings, or other sources for future reference. Effective practices within this pattern include summarizing, paraphrasing, and organizing information. To tackle common challenges like information overload and disorganization, students can utilize various note-taking methods and tools, such as the Cornell method, mind maps, or digital note-taking applications.
